title: JSE Falls on Escalating Trade Tensions
text:
PSG Wealth Daily Investment Update, 1 October 2019

The JSE ended lower on Monday as investors digested news that Washington may limit its capital flows to China. The JSE All Share lost 0.69%.Notwithstanding escalating trade tensions, Wall Street indices rose on Monday following a stellar performance by Apple Inc (NASDAQ: ). Just after the JSE closed, the went up by 0.53%, while the gained 0.56%.European shares were flat on Monday as investors shrugged off imminent US tariffs on European imports and to US President Donald Trump’s latest effort to limit US investments into China. Shortly after the JSE closed, the had lost 0.22%.Hong Kong stocks traded higher on Monday, driven by a rally in AB InBev’s Asia-Pacific unit. However, the was on track for its worst quarterly performance in four years amid local turmoil. The Hang Seng Index gained 0.25%.The lost 0.56% on Monday, as simmering trade tensions weighed on sentiment.The rand weakened against the dollar on Monday as the US-China trade spat took its toll on the local currency while investors awaited feedback from the NEC special meeting. At 18h20 a dollar traded at R15.15.Gold prices fell on Monday amid contradicting narratives on the US-China standoff. This has resulted in a sell-off in equities and an uptick in bond markets. An ounce of traded at $1 470.91 at 18h30.Oil prices rose on Monday after China increased production in September, easing apprehensions over demand. At 18h30 a barrel of traded at $60.94.
